metadata.description: Code-First Deep Threat Modeling - LLM-native security analysis framework with automated 8-phase workflow, dual-track knowledge architecture (Security Controls + Threat Patterns), and comprehensive verification capabilities. Transform any codebase into structured threat models without design documents.

plugins.name: threat-modeling
plugins.description: Code-First Deep Threat Modeling Skill with strict 8-phase sequential workflow: P1 Project Understanding, P2 Call Flow & DFD Analysis, P3 Trust Boundary Evaluation, P4 Security Design Review, P5 STRIDE Threat Analysis, P6 Risk Validation with POC Design, P7 Mitigation Planning with ASVS alignment, P8 Report Generation with mandatory outputs.

installation.post_install: Skill auto-activates when triggered by: 'threat model', 'STRIDE', 'security assessment', 'DFD', 'risk analysis', '威胁建模', '安全评估'

phases: P1: Project Understanding - Codebase structure analysis, tech stack detection
P2: Call Flow & DFD - Data flow diagram construction from code
P3: Trust Boundary - Security zone identification and boundary mapping
P4: Security Design Review - 16 security domain assessment matrix
P5: STRIDE Analysis - Systematic threat enumeration with KB integration
P6: Risk Validation - Attack path verification, POC design, count conservation
P7: Mitigation Planning - Tech-specific remediation with ASVS alignment
P8: Report Generation - 4 mandatory reports + 6 phase documents

extended.name: Lightweight Quick Scan
extended.use_case: Initial security review or time-constrained assessments

extended.name: Single-Phase Deep Analysis
extended.description: Deep dive into specific phase (e.g., P5 STRIDE only)
extended.use_case: Focused analysis on specific security domain

extended.name: Delta Assessment
extended.use_case: Security review for pull requests or releases

extended.name: Penetration Test Support
extended.description: Generate POC-focused attack paths from P6

design_principles.code_first: No design documents required - analyze directly from codebase
design_principles.llm_autonomous: Knowledge base provides context, not control - LLM performs semantic reasoning
design_principles.dual_track_knowledge: Security Control Set (defensive) + Threat Pattern Set (offensive)
design_principles.context_not_control: Empower LLM intelligence rather than constrain it
design_principles.script_as_blackbox: Scripts handle deterministic operations, LLM handles semantic analysis
